Using Large Language Models in R

Graham French

Source: vignettes/using_llms_in_r.qmd

URLs

  • openAI and chatGPT

Blogs

  • The Modern R Stack for Production AI (Stephen Turner 2025-06-02)
  • Which AI model writes the best R code? (Sara Altman and Simon Couch)
  • Computer vision with LLMs in R (Frank Hull)

Videos

  • Harnessing LLMs for data analysis (Joe Cheng, 2025-05-28)

Packages

  • ellmer - use large language models (LLM) from R
  • gander - allows large language models to talk to your R environment
  • ragnar - helps implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) workflows

Other packages (not on CRAN)

  • btw - describe your R environment to a large language model (in development)
  • vitals - large language model evaluation in R
  • kuzco - computer vision assistant library in R, using Ollama
  • querychat - drop-in component for Shiny that allows users to query a data frame using natural language to create SQL query

Uses

Chatbots

  • shinychat - Chat UI component for Shiny for R. with Ellmer Assistant Chatbot
  • Shiny Assistant, with live Shiny Assistant Chatbot

Structured data extraction

Programming

  • chores - a library of ergonomic LLM assistants designed to help you complete repetitive, hard-to-automate tasks quickly

Sentiment text analysis

  • mall - provides functions for sentiment analysis, text summarization, text classification, extraction, translation and verification

On this page

Developed by Graham French.
